* Starts the main execution loop of the application.
* Displays the welcome message and continuously processes user commands
* until an exit command is received.
* The main entry point for the application.
* Represents a custom exception specific to the Groot application.
* This exception is thrown when the application encounters errors related to
* user input, task parsing, or storage operations.
* Initializes a new GrootException with a specific error message.
* @param message The detailed error message describing the cause of the exception.
* Deals with making sense of the user command.
* The Parser class interprets the user input and triggers the
* appropriate responses and task list modifications.
* Parses the full user input and executes the corresponding command.
* @param input   The raw string entered by the user.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to be modified.

* @param storage The storage handler to save changes.
* @return true if the command is "bye" (exits the app), false otherwise.
* @throws GrootException If the command is invalid or the parameters are incorrect.

* Provides unit tests for the {@link TaskList} class.
* Verifies that tasks can be added correctly and that edge cases, such as
* invalid index access, are handled via exceptions.
* Tests that adding a Todo task correctly increments the size of the TaskList.
* Tests that attempting to remove a task using an invalid index throws
* a {@link GrootException} with the correct error message.
assertEquals("Invalid task number. I can't prune what isn't there!", e.getMessage());

* correct pipe-separated format for file storage.
* Verifies that a completed Todo task displays the correct completion
